channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: More firms shut down over COVID impact
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Reeling from the impact caused by the coronavirus disease 2019, more companies nationwide are opting to shut down or retrench workers.

item.title: Duterte to pursue stronger Philippines-China ties
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: As the Philippines marked 45 years of diplomatic relations with China, President Duterte reiterated Manila’s commitment to pursue stronger ties with Beijing.

item.title: PAGCOR hopes to reopen POGOs this month
item.author: Mary Grace Padin
item.description: The Philippine Amusement and Gaming Corp. is hoping for the resumption of offshore gaming operations this month as companies start to comply with the requirements set by the government.

item.title: Duterte awaits IATF report on GCQ
item.author: Emmanuel Tupas
item.description: Should the general community quarantine be retained or lifted in Metro Manila, Cebu City and several provinces?

item.title: Call special session to pass stimulus bill, Duterte urged
item.author: Delon Porcalla
item.description: Malacañang has said that without revenue sources, there cannot be an economic stimulus package.

item.title: DICT accelerates setup of WiFi hotspots
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: The Department of Information and Communications Technology is poised to accelerate the deployment of free WiFi hotspots to address the connectivity needs of the education sector under the new normal, where blended and distance learning will be implemented.

item.title: Palace: Anti-terror bill has enough safeguards
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: Malacañang said yesterday there are enough safeguards in the proposed Anti-Terrorism Act against possible abuse, and that President Duterte would subject the measure to close scrutiny with “public interest” in mind.

item.title: Notify government of your return, OFWs told
item.author: Mayen Jaymalin
item.description: Before returning home, overseas Filipino workers are now required to notify the government five days ahead of their arrival.

item.title: India vows to provide Philippines with anti-COVID vaccine
item.author: Edith Regalado
item.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has vowed to help the Philippines in its fight against the coronavirus disease 2019 by providing a vaccine now being developed by pharmaceutical firms in India.

item.title: ‘Travel bubbles’ eyed to revive tourism
item.author: Catherine Talavera
item.description: The Department of Tourism is planning to create “travel bubbles” on Philippine islands that have zero or few cases of coronavirus disease 2019 to revive tourism in those areas.
